emerging_technologies.name: General Purpose AI Agents
emerging_technologies.description: Agents capable of performing a wide array of tasks, learning from their environments, and adapting to user needs.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Will reduce labor-intensive jobs, enhance productivity, and potentially alter education by providing personalized learning experiences.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires advancements in computational power, ethical frameworks for decision-making, and societal acceptance of AI as co-workers.

emerging_technologies.name: Emotionally Intelligent Agents
emerging_technologies.description: AI agents that can recognize, interpret, and respond to human emotions, providing empathy and emotional support.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Can improve mental health support, customer satisfaction, and human-AI interactions, but raises concerns about privacy and emotional manipulation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Depends on advancements in AI's ability to understand complex human emotions and ethical guidelines to prevent misuse.

emerging_technologies.name: AI Governance Frameworks
emerging_technologies.description: Legal and ethical frameworks to manage and regulate the behavior of autonomous AI agents.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Will ensure AI agents operate within legal and ethical boundaries, reducing risks of AI misuse and fostering trust in AI systems.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption relies on global consensus on AI ethics, regulatory bodies, and the integration of blockchain for transparency.

emerging_technologies.name: Agent-Enabled Smart Cities
emerging_technologies.description: Integration of AI agents into urban infrastructure to manage and optimize city functions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could lead to more efficient cities, but also raises concerns about surveillance, privacy, and the digital divide.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires significant investment in smart infrastructure, public acceptance, and comprehensive data security measures.

mainstream_technologies.name: Personal AI Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: AI agents that integrate into daily life, assisting with personal tasks, scheduling, and information retrieval.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in consumer markets, with integration into devices and platforms.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Powered Autonomous Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Vehicles capable of self-driving with human-level or superior driving capabilities.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Increasingly adopted in specific regions with supportive regulations and infrastructure.

epoch_themes.description: A period where AI agents become ubiquitous in personal and professional life, enhancing productivity and decision-making.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Shift towards a society where AI is an integral part of daily life, potentially reducing human involvement in routine tasks.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased focus on AI ethics, education reform to include AI literacy, and regulatory frameworks to manage AI agents.

epoch_themes.description: Cities evolve with AI agents to become more efficient, sustainable, and responsive to citizens' needs.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Enhances urban living standards but raises concerns about privacy, equity, and the potential for increased surveillance.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push towards smart city initiatives, with collaborations between tech companies, governments, and urban planners.
